turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Staatenverbund.
turn.1: What is the English translation of the word Stattenverbund?
turn.2: Staatenverbund  Staatenverbund is a neologism for a system of multi-level governance in which states work more closely together in a confederation but, unlike a federal state, retain their own sovereignty.
turn.3: What is an example of the word in American English?
turn.4: The concept is used in Germany to describe the European Union but has no direct equivalent in other languages.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: In German jurisprudence, a "Staatenverbund" is a supranational institution that may exercise sovereign acts (laws, coin money, etc.) but may not independently fix areas where it may exercise this power.
turn.7: Where was the word first used?
turn.8: This concept was first used in 1992 by German jurist Paul Kirchhof, although its initial meaning was not a legal one.
turn.9: When was the word first used?
turn.10: The term became established in the jurisprudence of the German Federal Constitutional Court with its 1993 judgement on the Maastricht Treaty.
turn.11: What did the Court say based on the definition?
turn.12: Subsequently, the concept has been taken in law and political scienceusually without any real awareness of its original meaningand was interpreted as the central position between a confederation and a federal form of government.
